The Art of
Text Editing

Helix is a modal editor built on a simple idea:select, then act. No Vim legacy. No Emacs chords. Just you and your text.

02 — Practice

Begin with the Fundamentals

Master these core concepts before advancing to complex multi-step transformations.

01

Basic Movement

easy

Navigate to the end of the line using h, j, k, l keys.

~12 keys
02

Word Navigation

easy

Use w, b, and e to navigate through words efficiently.

~6 keys
03

Character Selection

easy

Use x and X to select characters and lines.

~7 keys
04

Line Selection

easy

Select entire lines using x and X.

~3 keys
05

Extend Selection

medium

Use v to enter select mode and extend your selection.

~10 keys
"Helix is not Vim. It is not Emacs. It is aselection-first editor built on the principle that you should know what you're changingbefore you change it."
Read the Helix Philosophy
